p: According to the seasonal reports of the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), a significant increase in the number of human and equine cases was observed in 2018 in Hungary compared to previous transmission seasons in our region [ 14, 15]. In this work, we presented epidemic and epizootic data regarding the 2018 WNV situation in Hungary, along with genomic data in reference to these strains and their regional progenitors.
